skeleton2D

Class Skeleton2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • skeleton2D.Skeleton2D

  • public class Skeleton2D
extends java.lang.Object
    This algorithm is based on the paper Skeleton Extraction of 3D Objects with Visible Repulsive Force by Fu-Che Wu, Wan-Chun Ma, Ping-Chou Liou, Rung-Huei Liang and Ming Ouhyoung. Some changes are made for better results. This is the 2D implementation.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jim Stanev

    • Constructor Detail

      • Skeleton2D

        public Skeleton2D(double step,
          int sampling,
          int pushingFactor,
          int iteration,
          int distanceTolerance,
          int rootTolerance)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        step - the step of moving toward local minimum
        sampling - the sampling interval
        pushingFactor - the pushing factor
        iteration - the iteration index of vrf
        distanceTolerance - the distance tolerance for clustering
        rootTolerance - the root tolerance

        edges - edges of the polygon
        Returns:

      • vrf

        private Vector2D vrf(Point x,
           java.util.ArrayList<Point> visibleSet)
        VRF(x)~ = Σf(||vi-x||2)*(vi-x)~
        Parameters:
        x - interior of surface S
        visibleSet - the visible set
        Returns:
        the visible repulsive force

      • f

        private double f(double x)
        f(x) = 1/(x^2+c). The constant is added not to get inf.
        Parameters:
        x - input
        Returns:
        result

      • localeMinimum

        private java.util.ArrayList<Point> localeMinimum(Point seed,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<Segment> edges)
        Locates the local minimum of a seed point using the vrf(x), termination condition |vrf(x+1)|>|vrf(x)| (not working so iteration inserted) so iteration factor inserted.
        Parameters:
        seed - the initial position
        edges - the edges of the polygon
        Returns:
        a set of continues points

        Parameters:

        edges - the edges of the polygon
        Returns:
        the new position of p
